channel.title: Composer in the world of today
channel.description:
How the composer of today sees the contemporary world around him. Interviews, commentary and musical illustration provide a better picture of the modern composer. The series is hosted by Burrill Phillips, composer and professor of music at the University of Illinois.

An online collection of early educational public radio content from the National Association of Educational Broadcasters (NAEB).

image.title: Composer in the world of today

item.title: American work for chorus and orchestra
item.description: This program focuses on contemporary American compositions for choruses with orchestral accompaniment.
item.dc:creator: Phillips, Burrill
item.dc:subject: United States--History--20th century

item.title: Music by Peter Mennin
item.description: This program looks at the music of 20th century American composer Peter Mennin and how it illustrates characteristics of contemporary music midway through the century.
item.dc:creator: Phillips, Burrill
item.dc:subject: United States--History--20th century

item.title: Paradox of strict limitation
item.description: This program, "Paradox of Strict Limitation," discusses the virtues of self-imposed limitation in modern composition.
item.dc:creator: Phillips, Burrill
item.dc:subject: United States--History--20th century

item.title: Composers discuss music, part two
item.description: Two young American composers, Robert Wykes and Kenneth Gaburo, discussing their music. "Sextet for Strings" by Robert Wykes is performed.
item.dc:creator: Phillips, Burrill
item.dc:subject: United States--History--20th century

item.title: Composers discuss music, part one
item.description: This program, the first of two parts, features two young American composers, Robert Wykes and Kenneth Gaburo, discuss their music.
item.dc:creator: Phillips, Burrill
item.dc:subject: United States--History--20th century

item.title: Making the new out of the old
item.description: This program, "Making the New Out of the Old," focuses on compositions that strive to ignore standard tropes in songwriting. Bernard Rogers' composition "Leaves from the Tale of Pinocchio," is highlighted.
item.dc:creator: Rogers, Bernard, 1893-1968
item.dc:subject: United States--History--20th century

item.title: An unusual trio
item.description: This program, "An Unusual Trio," focuses on a trio consisting of piano, flute, and oboe.
item.dc:creator: Phillips, Burrill
item.dc:subject: United States--History--20th century

item.title: Four-hand music for piano
item.description: This program focuses on piano compositions for four hands, as well as the pianists who excel at four-hand piano.
item.dc:creator: Phillips, Burrill
item.dc:subject: United States--History--20th century

item.title: Chamber music for brass
item.description: This program, "Chamber Music for Brass," discusses a popular development in contemporary classical music at the time.
item.dc:creator: Phillips, Burrill
item.dc:subject: United States--History--20th century

item.title: American work for chorus and orchestra
item.description: This program focuses on contemporary American compositions for choruses with orchestral accompaniment.
item.dc:creator: Phillips, Burrill
item.dc:subject: United States--History--20th century

item.title: Symphony of premonition and reminiscence
item.description: This program, "A Symphony of Premonition and Reminiscence," focuses on the work of Henry Cowell.
item.dc:creator: Phillips, Burrill
item.dc:subject: United States--History--20th century
